Application.Filter

Class CookieFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Application.Filter.CookieFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.Filter

    @WebFilter(value="/*")
 @Order(value=1)
public class CookieFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.Filter
    Implementation of the Filter interface that checks the cookies exchanged between front-end and back-end.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Corti Lorenzo, Tocchetti Andrea

      • userRepository

        private final UserRepository userRepository

    • Constructor Detail

      • CookieFilter

        @Autowired
public CookieFilter(UserRepository userRepository,
                               AdministratorRepository administratorRepository)
        Constructor for the PageFilter class.
        Parameters:
        userRepository - autowired, used to access persistent data about a User.
        administratorRepository - autowired, used to access persistent data about an Administrator.

    • Method Detail

      • doFilter

        public void doFilter(javax.servlet.ServletRequest servletRequest,
                     javax.servlet.ServletResponse servletResponse,
                     javax.servlet.FilterChain filterChain)
              throws java.io.IOException,
                     javax.servlet.ServletException
        Implementation of the Filter.doFilter(javax.servlet.ServletRequest, javax.servlet.ServletResponse, javax.servlet.FilterChain) method from Filter class. Uses userRepository and administratorRepository to access and check persistent data about User(s) and Administrator(s). If the cookie user_id is passed it is checked to be valid, depending on the request. The same applies for the cookie cookieconsent_status . If set to 'deny' the session is invalidated.
        Specified by:
        doFilter in interface javax.servlet.Filter
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.servlet.ServletException
